intro: Pseudolysimachion pallens, commonly known as the pale pseudolysimachion, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and sorrels. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a smooth texture. Pseudolysimachion pallens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodland areas and stream sides.
